name: Fish Stew
description: Fish stew is a hearty soup or stew that features fish as its primary ingredient. It's a popular dish worldwide, with variations based on regional cuisines.
ingredients: 1 kg white fish (tilapia, Nile perch, etc.), cleaned and cut into chunks
1/2 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste)
instructions: Marinate the Fish: In a bowl, combine the fish pieces with the chopped onion, minced garlic, grated ginger, cumin powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well to ensure the fish is evenly coated with the marinade. Let it marinate for at least 30 minutes.

Cook the Fish: Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add the marinated fish pieces and cook, stirring occasionally, until they are browned on all sides and cooked through. This should take about 10-15 minutes. Once the fish is cooked, remove it from the pan and set aside.
Make the Stew: In the same pan, add the chopped tomato and cook until softened. Add the water, bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Season with salt to taste.

Combine and Serve: Return the cooked fish to the pan with the tomato sauce. Simmer for a few more minutes until the flavors are well combined. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with ugali, rice, or chapati.
